checks.description:
Check that files outside of the bin/ directory do not appear to be
 executable according to the Unix file command. From man file: files have
 a ``magic number'' stored in a particular place near the beginning of the
 file that tells the UNIX operating system that the file is a binary
 executable.
checks.name: check_for_executable_flag

checks.description:
Check that files outside of the bin/ and appserver/controllers directory do not have execute
 permissions and are not .exe files.
 On Unix platform, Splunk recommends 644 for all app files outside of the bin/ directory, 644 for
 scripts within the bin/ directory that are invoked using an interpreter (e.g. python my_script.py
 or sh my_script.sh), and 755 for scripts within the bin/ directory that are invoked directly
 (e.g. ./my_script.sh or ./my_script).
 On Windows platform, Splunk recommends removing user's FILE_GENERIC_EXECUTE for all app files outside
 of the bin/ directory except users in ['Administrators', 'SYSTEM', 'Authenticated Users', 'Administrator'].
checks.name: check_for_bin_files

groups.description:
ITSI module file and folder structure verification
All the ITSI modules should follow the following file structure:
splunk_home/etc/apps/module_folder - appserver[d] - static - default[d] - data[d] - models[d] - ui[d] - panels[d] - views[d] - app.conf[f] - deep_dive_drilldowns.conf[f] - inputs.conf[f] - itsi_kpi_base_search.conf[f] - itsi_kpi_template.conf[f] - itsi_module_viz.conf[f] - itsi_service_template.conf[f] - savedsearches.conf[f] - metadata[d] - default.meta[f]
Test files should not be included with the package. For example, a directory such as /etc/apps/module_folder/test should not exist.
groups.name: check_itsi_module_file_structure

and methods= properties.

web.conf

Custom visualizations support checks

Check that each stanza in default/vizualizations.conf has a matching

Check the required file appserver/static/visualizations/<viz_name>/preview.png

Check that custom visualizations have an

Check that each custom visualization stanza in

groups.description:
Cloud operations simple application check
This group serves to help validate simple applications in an effort to try and automate the validation process for cloud operations.
groups.name: check_cloud_simple_app

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain workload_rules.conf in Cloud as it
 automatically trigger actions on running search processes.
checks.name: check_workload_rules_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain workload_pools.conf in Cloud. App should
 not modify workload categories/pools. It should be only controlled by cloud
 administrators.
checks.name: check_workload_pools_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain wmi.conf is as it is prohibited in
 Splunk Cloud due to its ability to configure Splunk to ingest data via
 Windows Management Instrumentation, which should be done via forwarder.
 Forwarders are not permitted in Splunk Cloud.
checks.name: check_wmi_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain user-seed.conf as it is used to
 preconfigure default login and password information.
checks.name: check_user_seed_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that transforms.conf does not contain any transforms with malicious
 command scripts specified by external_cmd=<string> attribute, or does not contain
 a scripted lookup with python2 only script.
checks.name: check_transforms_conf_for_external_cmd

checks.description:
Check that the app does not contain configurations of default source type in props.conf,
 which will overwrite the configurations of default source types in system/default/props.conf
 then it will affect other apps in splunk enterprise/cloud.
checks.name: check_that_no_configurations_of_default_source_type_in_props_conf

checks.description:
Check that the app contains MS Windows specific components, which will not
 function correctly in Splunk Cloud whose OS should be Linux x64.
checks.name: check_that_app_contains_any_windows_specific_components

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain telemetry.conf as it controls a
 Splunk-internal feature that should not be configured by apps.
checks.name: check_telemetry_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain splunk-launch.conf as it defines
 environment values used at startup time. System-wide environment variables
 should be left up to Splunk administrators.
checks.name: check_splunk_launch_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain sourcetypes.conf as it is a
 machine-generated file that stores source type learning rules. props.conf
 should be used to define sourcetypes.
checks.name: check_sourcetypes_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain source-classifier.conf.conf as it
 configures system-wide settings for ignoring terms (such as sensitive
 data).
checks.name: check_source_classifier_conf_black_list

checks.description: Check that setup.xml does not exist in the app default folder
checks.name: check_setup_xml_in_default

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain serverclass.seed.xml.conf as it
 configures deploymentClient to seed a Splunk installation with applications
 at startup time. Apps should leave deployment configuration up to Splunk
 administrators.
checks.name: check_serverclass_seed_xml_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain serverclass.conf as it defines
 deployment server classes for use with deployment server. Apps should
 leave deployment configuration up to Splunk administrators.
checks.name: check_serverclass_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain segmenters.conf with splunk stanza. A misconfigured
 segmenters.conf can result in unsearchable data that could only be
 addressed by re-indexing and segmenters.conf configuration is system-wide.
checks.name: check_segmenters_conf_black_list

checks.description: Check the cmd path pattern of scripted input defined in inputs.conf.
checks.name: check_scripted_inputs_cmd_path_pattern

checks.description: Check that Splunk SDK for Python is up-to-date.
checks.name: check_python_sdk_version

messages.message: Splunk SDK for Python not found.

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain pubsub.conf as it defines a custom
 client for the deployment server. Apps should leave deployment
 configuration up to Splunk administrators.
checks.name: check_pubsub_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that there is a script file in bin/ for each modular input
 defined in README/inputs.conf.spec.
checks.name: check_modular_inputs_scripts_exist_for_cloud

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain messages.conf. Apps should not
 alter/override messages/externalized strings.
checks.name: check_messages_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain literals.conf. Apps should not
 alter/override text strings displayed in Splunk Web.
checks.name: check_literals_conf_black_list

checks.description: Check that Splunk SDK for Java is up-to-date.
checks.name: check_java_sdk_version

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain crawl.conf
 as it allows Splunk to introspect the filesystem which is not
 permitted in Splunk Cloud.
checks.name: check_introspection_of_cloud_filesystem

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain instance.cfg.conf. Apps should not
 configure server/instance specific settings.
checks.name: check_instance_cfg_conf_black_list

checks.description: Check that inputs.conf does not have any UDP inputs.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_udp

checks.description:
Check that indexes defined in indexes.conf use relative paths starting
 with $SPLUNK_DB.
checks.name: check_indexes_conf_only_uses_splunk_db_variable

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain health.conf as sc_admin is not able
 to see or configure health report in Cloud.
checks.name: check_health_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check whether the app contains shell files. Shell files will be manually inspected
 for compliance with Splunk Cloud security policy.
checks.name: check_for_shell

checks.description: Check that the app does not contain reverse shells.
checks.name: check_for_reverse_shells

checks.description:
Check if the app contains Perl scripts. Perl scripts will be inspected
 for compliance with Splunk Cloud security policy.
checks.name: check_for_perl

messages.message: No Perl scripts found in app.

checks.description:
Check third party libraries for known vulnerabilities. Splunk Cloud
 Application Security policy defines "Included application libraries have
 multiple vulnerabilities not covered by the components in Transit" as a
 moderate security risk and may or may not be permitted based on
 cumulative risk score.
checks.name: check_for_known_vulnerabilities_in_third_party_libraries

messages.message: Please check for known vulnerabilities in third-party libraries. Use these links: https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/search. and https://nvd.nist.gov/cvss.cfm

checks.description:
Check whether the app contains java files. Java files will be inspected
 for compliance with Splunk Cloud security policy.
checks.name: check_for_java

messages.message: No java files found in app.

checks.description:
Check the [fifo] stanza in inputs.conf is not pointing to a path
 within a cloud replicated scope defined by distsearch.conf. [fifo] usually
 points to a file whose size may inflate. This kind of files MUST NOT be replicated across cloud
 environments since they will significantly consume network bandwidth.
checks.name: check_for_inputs_fifo_usage

checks.description: Check that indexes.conf does not declare volumes.
checks.name: check_for_index_volume_usage

checks.description:
Check that use of
 'tscollect'
 in .conf filesl and dashboard xmls then fail it.
checks.name: check_for_implementing_tscollect

checks.description:
Check that all executable binary files have matching source code. For any binary files, there
 should be a source code provided with the same name. Or, there should be a decalaration of what the
 binary file is all about in the app's REAMDE. Details for passing this check will be returned if you fail
 it.
checks.name: check_for_binary_files_without_source_code

checks.description: Check that the app does not implement auto-update features.
checks.name: check_for_auto_update_features

messages.message: No scripts found in /bin or architecture-specific directories in app.

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain deploymentclient.conf as it configures
 the deployment server client. Apps should leave deployment configuration up
 to Splunk administrators.
checks.name: check_deploymentclient_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain deployment.conf. Apps should leave
 deployment configuration up to Splunk administrators.
Also, deployment.conf has been removed and replaced by:
 1) deploymentclient.conf - for configuring Deployment Clients
 2) serverclass.conf - for Deployment Server server class configuration.
checks.name: check_deployment_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain default-mode.conf is as it is
 prohibited in Splunk Cloud due to the fact that Splunk Light Forwarders and
 Splunk Universal Forwarders are not run in Splunk Cloud.
checks.name: check_default_mode_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain datatypesbnf.conf, as it is prohibited
 in Splunk Cloud.
checks.name: check_datatypesbnf_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that custom search commands have an executable or script per
 stanza.
checks.name: check_command_scripts_exist_for_cloud

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain bookmarks.conf as this
 feature is not available in Splunk Cloud.
checks.name: check_bookmarks_conf_black_list

checks.description:
Check that app does not contain audit.conf, as it is prohibited in
 Splunk Cloud due to its ability to configure/disable cryptographic signing
 and certificates.
checks.name: check_audit_conf_black_list

checks.description: Check that the app does not have passwords.conf, otherwise, warn it.
checks.name: check_that_passwords_conf_not_exist

checks.description: Check that the static/ directory contains only known file types. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as metadata files.
checks.name: check_static_directory_file_white_list

checks.description: Check that only role-mapping stanza is allowed in authenticaiton.conf as long as it doesn't map users to a cloud-internal role.
checks.name: check_stanza_of_authentication_conf

checks.description: Check that python version is python3 for scripted inputs defined in inputs.conf.
checks.name: check_scripted_inputs_python_version

checks.description: Check that the metadata/ directory only contains .meta files. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as metadata files.
checks.name: check_metadata_white_list

checks.description: Check that lookups/ contains only approved file types (.csv, .csv.default, .csv.gz, .csv.tgz, .kmz) or files formatted as valid csv. Ensure malicious files are not passed off as lookup files.
checks.name: check_lookups_white_list

checks.description: Check that default/inputs.conf or local/inputs.conf does not contain a tcp stanza.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_tcp

checks.description: Check that inputs.conf does not have any SSL inputs.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_ssl

checks.description: Check that default/inputs.conf or local/inputs.conf does not contain a splunktcptoken stanza.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_splunktcptoken

checks.description: Check that default/inputs.conf or local/inputs.conf does not contain a splunktcp stanza.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_splunk_tcp

checks.description: Check that inputs.conf does not have any remote_queue inputs.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_remote_queue_monitor

checks.description:
Check that default/inputs.conf or local/inputs.conf contains accurate [http://name]
 stanza if it exists.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_http_local_stanza_usage

checks.description:
Check that default/inputs.conf or local/inputs.conf does not contain a [http]
 stanza.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_http_global_usage

checks.description:
Check that default/inputs.conf or local/inputs.conf does not contain a fschange
 stanza.
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_fschange

checks.description:
Check that batch input accesses files in a permitted way.
To be permissible, the batch input must meet the following criteria:
 1) The file path needs to match a file in the directory "$SPLUNK_HOME/var/spool/splunk/"
 2) The file name needs to be application specific "$SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/"
 3) The file name should not end with "stash" or "stash_new"
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_for_batch

checks.description:
Check that batch input has required attributes.
 The following key/value pairs are required for batch inputs:
 move_policy = sinkhole
checks.name: check_inputs_conf_batch_has_required_attributes

checks.description: Check for disallowed stanzas in authorize.conf.
checks.name: check_for_disallowed_tokens_auth_in_authorize_conf

checks.description: Check if concerningReplicatedFileSize in distsearch.conf is larger than 50 MB.
checks.name: check_distsearch_conf_for_concerning_replicated_file_size

checks.description: Check that directories under data/ui contain only allowed files. Identify for manual review items that might cause passwords to be stored in plaintext.
checks.name: check_default_data_ui_manager_for_plain_text_credentials

checks.description: Check that directories under data/ui contain only allowed files. Ensure unnecessary, unwanted files are not bundled in the app inappropriately.
checks.name: check_default_data_ui_file_white_list

checks.description: Check that authorize.conf does not grant excessive administrative permissions to the user. Prevent roles from gaining unauthorized permissions.
checks.name: check_authorize_conf_admin_all_objects_privileges

checks.description: Check that commands referenced in the alert.execute.cmd property of all alert actions are checked for compliance with Splunk Cloud security policy. Prevent alert_actions.conf from being used to execute malicious commands.
checks.name: check_alert_actions_conf_for_alert_execute_cmd_properties

groups.description:
Splunk app packaging standards
These checks validate that a Splunk app has been correctly packaged, and can be provided safely for package validation.
groups.name: check_packaging_standards

checks.description:
Check that the extracted Splunk App contains a default/app.conf file
 that contains an [id] or [launcher] stanza with a version property that
 is formatted as Major.Minor.Revision.
checks.name: check_valid_version_number

messages.message: Splunk App packages doesn't contain `app.manifest file`. No `app.manifest` was found.

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk App package with a .dependencies directory also
 contains exactly one valid app folder.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_with_static_dependencies_has_exactly_one_app_folder

messages.message: No ../.dependencies folder found. Please add a .dependencies directory with an valid app folder.

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk App package with a .dependencies directory also
 contains an app folder with an app.manifest.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_with_static_dependencies_has_app_manifest

messages.message: No ../.dependencies folder found. Please add a .dependencies directory that contains an app folder with an app.manifest.

checks.description: Check that the Splunk app provided a valid compressed file.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_valid_compressed_file

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk app provided does not start with a .
 character.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_name_does_not_start_with_period

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk App package contains only valid dependencies.
 Dependencies are valid if a .dependencies directory contains only valid
 app packages inside.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_has_valid_static_dependencies

messages.message: No ../.dependencies folder found. Please check that the Splunk App package contains only valid dependencies.

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk app provided does not contain incorrect permissions.
 Packages must have have the owner's read permission set to r (400).
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_has_read_permission

checks.description:
Check that the compressed artifact extracts to a directory that does not
 start with a . character.
checks.name: check_that_splunk_app_package_extracts_to_visible_directory

checks.description:
Check that the Splunk App package does not contain any non-app files.

 folder are permitted, all other files are not.

checks.description:
Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any directories or
 files that start with a ., or directories that start with __MACOSX.

Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any directories

checks.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contain_invalid_directories

checks.description:
Check that the extracted Splunk App does not contain any files
 with incorrect permissions. Files must have the owner's
 permissions include read and write (600).
checks.name: check_that_extracted_splunk_app_does_not_contain_files_with_invalid_permissions

checks.description:
Check that the extracted Splunk App contains a default/app.conf
 file.
